TopicTitle: Pteron Micro Shuttle and rescue vehicle Beta download available(9/9/2014)

Articles.Content: Nike-7 Left on final wait for Adidas-12 Right departing.....

*clicks thread tools, finds and selected subscribe to thread*

Ah now that is done, VERY VERY well done shoe., *someone taps on shoulder and whispers, then clears throat.* er um I meant Shuttle design! I really like how it is looking and look forward to testing it out at our facilities. But I do ask this what is the chances of it have single stage to orbit possibilities I do know that it is small but I have see some very small craft in the SSTO challenges.

LOVE the work, keep it up!

Damaske

CEO of The Mass Key shipyards

P.S. does helldiver know aboot this inspired project offshoot?

Think I may make a special version of VNG's superb parachute module that is the same as the old Reebok pumps inflator thingy for when I have to eject. Continue the trainer theme...

*Edit It's gonna say jump instead of pump*

Delivering the Pteron to orbit with a Scram/SABRE winged "Atmospheric Service Stage" rear extension design studies have commenced. These helped pass a very boring weekend away from the PC. However, The Pterons tiny size makes an SSTO impractical without some form of extension. http://www.deepcold.com/deepcold/spiral_main.html Does this count as SSTO or at least DSTO?

I'm glad that uvmap is working out for you. I like the precise heat tiles, much crisper than my quick and dirty sculpt.
Well it has no normals yet cause I changed the format of the tiles

Delivering the Pteron to orbit with a Scram/SABRE winged "Atmospheric Service Stage" rear extension design studies have commenced. These helped pass a very boring weekend away from the PC. However, The Pterons tiny size makes an SSTO impractical without some form of extension. http://www.deepcold.com/deepcold/spiral_main.html Does this count as SSTO or at least DSTO?

Not sure if a dual stage to orbit would work for some of the challenges out there but it might be worth a shot to look into. Once the mod/shuttle is released I'll fiddle with it some and see what i can squeeze from it.
You can go stick some 1M tank and engine behind the micro shuttle and make a big delta wing in the back, making the wing of the shuttle a canard.
What engines would this use perhaps Dtobi's micro shuttle engines

or just that LV-909 / the Atlas engine (either from B9 or NovaPunch2)

maybe even the Poodle, as i dont know what size the nodes will be

It looks 1m or less, a poodle is 2m, not sure what engines the author had in mind, though I hope it's compatible with standard engines and doesn't have it's own proprietary one, hope this thing doesn't go too KSO.
Well, the back of the shuttle is going to be a standard 1.25m port, so I'd guess 0.675m engines would be the best option.
